intro: Herniaria cashmeriana, commonly known as Kashmir herniaria, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the Himalayan regions. It belongs to the family Crambeae and is characterized by its prostrate habit and small, fleshy leaves. The plant produces white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in rocky and alpine environments, often found in dry, well-drained soils. Its unique morphology and habitat make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
